question: What are the six fundamental rights guaranteed by the Constitution of India under Part III?
article: General: Part III of the Constitution

options.text: Right to equality, right to freedom, right against exploitation, right to property, right to constitutional remedies, and right to religion
Right to equality, right to freedom, right against exploitation, right to freedom of religion, cultural and educational rights, and right to constitutional remedies
Right to freedom, right to property, right against exploitation, right to equality, and right to religion
Right to life, right to education, right to freedom, right to property, right to speech, and right to equality

question: What does Article 14 of the Constitution guarantee?

options.text: Equality before the law and equal protection of the laws

question: Which Article guarantees the right to freedom of speech and expression?
Which Article of the Constitution abolishes untouchability?
Which Article guarantees protection against discrimination on the grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth?
Under which Article are citizens guaranteed the right to life and personal liberty?
article: Article 21: Protection of Life and Personal Liberty

question: Which Article guarantees the right to constitutional remedies?
What does Article 23 prohibit?
article: Article 23: Prohibition of Traffic in Human Beings and Forced Labour

options.text: Traffic in human beings, begar, and forced labour

question: Which Article protects the cultural and educational rights of minorities?
article: Article 29: Protection of Interests of Minorities

question: Which Article guarantees the right to freedom of religion?
article: Article 25: Freedom of Conscience and Free Profession, Practice, and Propagation of Religion

question: Which Article provides the right against exploitation, specifically prohibiting child labor in hazardous conditions?
article: Article 24: Prohibition of Employment of Children in Factories, etc.

question: Which Article guarantees equality of opportunity in matters of public employment?
article: Article 16: Equality of Opportunity in Matters of Public Employment

options.text: Titles except for military and academic distinctions

question: Which Article guarantees the right to education for all children?
Which Article deals with the freedom to manage religious affairs?
article: Article 26: Freedom to Manage Religious Affairs
